content: hodge why yes sir but i have had cats whom i liked better than this and then as if perceiving hodge to be out of countenance adding but he is a very fine cat a very fine cat indeed samuel johnston 1733 1816 hodge is a fine baby shoe named after hodge samuel johnston s favourite cat like hodge the cat hodge the baby shoe is a very fine shoe seemingly plain its charm is in its ease of use the fold-down cuff holds the stretchy 1x1 ribbing snugly against wee baby legs so there are no fiddly buttons or bows and the corrugated sides let the bootie stretch and bounce back instead of being kicked off if you give one to new parents they will thank you nicely and you might be disappointed but the very next time they see you they will remark on the booties thank you for them again and say they are a favourite and much better than other booties make sure to knit it at a firm gauge if knit to loose the bootie will stretch and not stay on as well use thicker yarn or smaller needles to get gauge a very fine bootie a fine bootie indeed the pattern is written to fit a preemie or newborn the 3-6 month size is given in brackets if you think it will be a bonnie baby knit the larger size or knit with thicker yarn and upsize the needles to get a bootie for a larger babe the boottie is knit at a firm gauge this is part of the trick to making the bootie stay on a loose gauge will result in a bootie that stretches more readily and slides off more easily the rib and fold down cuff have to be knit firm there are two variations of this bootie a plainer version and one with a pretty lace trimmed cuff and instep the pattern for the plain version is first with the modification for the lace bootie included at the end corrected stitch counts after picking up stitches around instep and improved version lace for cuff and instep november 2017 requirements abbreviations both sizes - small skein of sock yarn 25 g st s stitches vintage purls sock 2 25 mm needles s1 means slip one stitch as if to purl with the yarn in back set of 5 dpns 2 circulars or one 80 cm circular stitch marker k2tog - knit two stitches together crochet hook to match yarn p2tog purl two stitches together needle to weave in ends ssk slip one stitch as if to knit slip next stitch as if to knit replace both stitches to left hand needle knit both together through the back loops gauge 8 5 spi any looser and the booties won t stay on start cast on 36 40 stitches join into the round using your favourite technique being careful not to twist the round my favourite method to join up a round
